metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5731 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in examples/openid.php in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.16, 4.4.x before 4.4.15.7, and 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving an OpenID error message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
